ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question for you druids out there ...
ygData.msgSnippet: I think it also depends on how well you know the other person you re grouping with. sometimes after grouping with someone numerous times or for a long period
ygData.messageBody:
I think it also depends on how well you "know" the other person you're
grouping with. sometimes after grouping with someone numerous times or for a
long period of time people (at least in my groups) just say "sow wore off"
or "___ buff wore off"-- so the person who casts the spell will just
automatically cast the spell when mana permits. The intention is not to be
rude.
luv,
-Su

I'm a 17th level druid and have only experienced this a couple of times and
usually ignore them especially when they are rude about it. My husband and
I both play at the same time and usually group together, and occasionally we
will pick up someone and group with them. I think what I hate the most is
when the other people in the group ask for SoW's and do it quite rudely.

/g SOW me

HOW RUDE>>>!!!!

Usually when people do that I tell my husband that I want to leave the group
or don't buff that guy as much as the others. I can't stand that. If
people want to group because I know its better and you can fight more, lets
try not being so RUDE!

Nwinie
17th Druid
Lanys'T'Vyl
